p: The consumption of baobab seed oil has been reported to cause potential health risks caused by the presence of these carcinogenic ingredients [ 22â€“ 25] with medical and mutagenic effects on animals [ 26, 27] and carcinogenic effects [ 28, 29]. Despite the increased consumption and popularity of baobab oil due to its medicinal values, FDA [ 30] issued an alarming statement condemning the consumption of baobab oil for health reasons. Furthermore, according to [ 30], the health effect of baobab is caused by the presence of carcinogenic ingredients known as CPFAs. Although the consumption of baobab oil is discouraged in Tanzania, evidence shows that most people are still using it for the treatment of various diseases.
